p: Licensed vaccines such as BCG and oral polio vaccine have been shown to have nonspecific, modulatory effects on the immune system and provide protection against other infectious diseases [60], [61], [62], [63], [64]. This has led to the suggestion that these vaccines may have an effect in the prevention of COVID-19 [65]. Three multi-centred randomised controlled trials on BCG vaccine administration are underway in health care workers in Australia [66], Netherlands [67] and South Africa [68]. A measles vaccine trial to prevent COVID-19 in health care workers in Egypt has been registered [58] and oral polio vaccines are being considered in the United States of America [69].
